legendary.text: The Lord of Blades moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then makes one attack with his adamantine sixblade. He can make one bladed wings attack against each creature he moves past.

monster.spells: fire bolt, mage hand, mending, prestidigitation, expeditious retreat, sanctuary, thunderwave, blur, heat metal, scorching ray, see invisibility, dispel magic, fly, haste, freedom of movement, Mordenkainen's faithful hound, animate objects, wall of force

monster.name: Tsucora Quori
monster.resist: psychic

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 307

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
trait.text: The quori's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:
At will: charm person
1/day: fear

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The quori makes three attacks: one pincer attack, one attack with its claws, and one stinger attack.

action.name: Pincer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14) if it is a Large or smaller creature. The quori has two pincers, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the quori for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
action.text: One humanoid that the quori can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

monster.spells: charm person, fear

monster.name: Undying Councilor

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 311

trait.name: Aura of Radiance
trait.text: The councilor magically sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. The councilor can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action. If the bright light overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created that darkness is dispelled.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The councilor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The councilor is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): bless, command, create or destroy water
• 2nd level (3 slots): augury, calm emotions, hold person
• 3rd level (3 slots): daylight, dispel magic, spirit guardians
• 4th level (3 slots): banishment, divination, guardian of faith
• 5th level (2 slots): dispel evil and good, flame strike (see "Actions" below), scrying
• 6th level (1 slots): forbiddance, planar ally
• 7th level (1 slots): plane shift

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The councilor makes two Radiant Touch attacks.

action.name: Radiant Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) radiant damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
action.text: The councilor touches another creature. The target magically regains 18 (3d8 + 5) hit points and is freed from one curse afflicting it (councilor's choice).

action.name: Flame Strike (5th-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
action.text: The councilor chooses a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the councilor casts this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage or the radiant damage (its choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (2/Turn)
legendary.text: The councilor can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The councilor regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Touch
legendary.text: The councilor makes one attack with its Radiant Touch.

legendary.name: Shimmering Aura (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The councilor channels positive energy into its Aura of Radiance. Until the end of the councilor's next turn, it sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Any creature that starts its turn in the bright light must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the councilor's next turn.

monster.spells: guidance, mending, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy, bless, command, create or destroy water, augury, calm emotions, hold person, daylight, dispel magic, spirit guardians, banishment, divination, guardian of faith, dispel evil and good, flame strike, scrying, forbiddance, planar ally, plane shift

monster.name: Undying Soldier
monster.resist: radiant; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 311

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The soldier magically sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The soldier can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The soldier makes two spear attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage if the target is a fiend or undead.

monster.name: Valenar Hawk
monster.languages: understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 312

trait.name: Bonding
trait.text: The hawk can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the hawk bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the hawk and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The hawk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.name: Valenar Hound
monster.languages: understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 312

trait.name: Bonding
trait.text: The hound can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the hound bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the hound and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.name: Valenar Steed
monster.languages: understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 313

trait.name: Bonding
trait.text: The steed can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within 30 feet of it. The bond lasts until the steed bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the steed and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to 100 feet.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Warforged Colossus
monster.immune: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, incapacitated, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 314

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the colossus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Towering Terror
trait.text: Any enemy outside the colossus that starts its turn within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 26 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the start of the enemy's next turn. If the enemy's saving throw is successful, it is immune to this colossus's Towering Terror for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The colossus makes three attacks—one with its slam and two with its eldritch turrets—and then uses Stomp.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the colossus can push the target up to 20 feet away from it.

action.name: Eldritch Turret
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +18 to hit, range 300 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is knocked prone.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: The colossus stomps one of its feet at a point on the ground within 20 feet of it. Any creature in a 20-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered on this point must succeed on a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage and fall prone. Until the colossus uses its Stomp again or moves, the creature is restrained. While restrained in this way, the creature (or another creature within 5 feet of it) can use its action to make a DC 26 Strength check. On a success, the creature relocates to an unoccupied space of its choice within 5 feet of the colossus and is no longer restrained.
Structures, as well as nonmagical objects that are neither being worn nor carried, take the same amount of damage if they are in the cylinder (no save).

action.name: Incinerating Beam (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The colossus fires a beam of light in a 150-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw, taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this beam is disintegrated, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

monster.name: Warforged Soldier
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 320

trait.name: Warforged Resilience
trait.text: The warforged has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and is immune to disease. Magic can't put it to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warforged makes two armblade attacks.

action.name: Armblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Protection
reaction.text: When an attacker the warforged can see makes an attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of the warforged, the warforged can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Warforged Titan
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 315

trait.name: Platforms
trait.text: The warforged titan has two platforms built into its chassis. One Medium or smaller creature can ride on each platform without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within 5 feet of the warforged, they must use spears or weapons with reach and the target must be Large or larger.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The warforged titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warforged titan makes one axehand attack and one hammerfist attack.

action.name: Axehand
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage, plus 11 (2d10) slashing damage if the target is prone.

action.name: Hammerfist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Sweeping Axe (Recharge 6)
action.text: The warforged titan makes a sweep with its axehand, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Zakya Rakshasa
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.vulnerable: piercing from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 309

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: detect thoughts, disguise self
1/day: shield

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
trait.text: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 1st level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The rakshasa's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Martial Prowess (1/Turn)
trait.text: When the rakshasa hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 11 (2d10) damage of the weapon's type, and the creature must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the rakshasa can push the creature up to 10 feet away from it, knock the creature prone, or make the creature drop one item it is holding of the rakshasa's choice.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The rakshasa makes three melee weapon attacks. Alternatively, it can make two ranged attacks with its javelins.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Javelin
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.spells: detect thoughts, disguise self, shield

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 61

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 2 + your Intelligence modifier + five times your artificer level (the defender has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your artificer level)

trait.name: Saving Throws
trait.text: Dex +1 plus PB, Con +2 plus PB

trait.name: Skills
trait.text: Athletics +2 plus PB, Perception +0 plus PB × 2

trait.name: CR
trait.text: Proficiency Bonus (PB) equals your bonus

trait.name: Vigilant
trait.text: The defender can't be surprised.

action.name: Force-Empowered Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. Hit: 1d8 + PB force damage.

action.name: Repair (3/Day)
action.text: The magical mechanisms inside the defender restore 2d8 + PB hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

reaction.name: Deflect Attack
reaction.text: The defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll of one creature it can see that is within 5 feet of it, provided the attack roll is against a creature other than the defender.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Eberron: Rising from the Last War p. 62

trait.name: Hit Points
trait.text: 1 + your Intelligence modifier + your artificer level (the homunculus has a number of Hit Dice [d4s] equal to your artificer level)

trait.name: Saving Throws
trait.text: Dex +2 plus PB

trait.name: Skills
trait.text: Perception +0 plus PB × 2, Stealth +2 plus PB

trait.name: CR
trait.text: Proficiency Bonus (PB) equals your bonus

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the homunculus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can’t use this trait if it’s incapacitated.

action.name: Force Strike
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, range 30 ft., one target you can see. Hit: 1d4 + PB force damage.

reaction.name: Channel Magic
reaction.text: The homunculus delivers a spell you cast that has a range of touch. The homunculus must be within 120 feet of you.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 209

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The chaos quadrapod has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chaos quadrapod makes up to two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The chaos quadrapod can grapple no more than two targets at a time.

action.name: Chaos Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The chaos quadrapod shoots forth a knot of roiling ethereal light that explodes at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Clockwork Dragon
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 209

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the clockwork dragon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a metal statue.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The clockwork dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Keg Robot
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 212

trait.name: Customizable Storage
trait.text: A keg robot can hold up to three types of liquid payload totaling 12 gallons within its hollow, barrel-shaped body. A full keg robot can make one liquid attack per gallon before the liquid must be refilled. Filling a keg robot takes 2 rounds per gallon. Differing payloads can alter the keg robot's attacks from those presented here.

action.name: Fist
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Acid Squirt
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/40 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) acid damage.

action.name: Beer Shower
action.text: The keg robot spews an unnaturally potent beer in a 15-foot cone or in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a creature has its speed halved by exposure to the potent brew. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Additionally, the beer shower extinguishes any fires or open flames in its area.

action.name: Hot Oil Spray (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The keg robot sprays hot oil in a 15-foot cone or in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 (1d8 + 3) fire damage and falls prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone.
Any creature affected by the hot oil spray that takes fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute) takes an additional 3 (1d6) fire damage, and the oil burns away.

If the oil that remains in the area of the spray is lit, it burns for 1d4 rounds and deals 3 (1d6) fire damage to any creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 213

trait.name: Defensive Advantage
trait.text: As long as two or more of Splugoth's allies are within 5 feet of him and are not incapacitated, attack rolls against him are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: Splugoth can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of his turns.

trait.name: Touch of Madness
trait.text: Splugoth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Splugoth makes two attacks with his dagger.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Word From Beyond (1/day)
action.text: Splugoth remembers and repeats aloud a few words from a place he entered while walking back from the next world to this one. Each creature of his choice within 30 feet of him that can hear him must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Absorb Attack
reaction.text: When a creature Splugoth can see hits him with a melee weapon attack, the weapon snags on a pocket of residual resurrectional energy and is caught fast. The attack is negated and the weapon cannot be used until the creature succeeds on a DC 12 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to pull it out of Splugoth. Natural weapons can have their attacks negated by this feature, but can then be retracted automatically at the end of the attacking creature's turn.

monster.name: Ancient Deep Crow
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 211

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The ancient deep crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the ancient deep crow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ancient deep crow makes three attacks: one with its mandibles and two with its claws.

action.name: Mandibles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the ancient deep crow can't use its mandibles on another target.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Shadow Caw
action.text: The ancient deep crow releases an ear-splitting caw. Each creature within 60 feet of the crow and able to hear it must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

legendary.text: The monstrosity can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The monstrosity regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: The deep crow makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Shadow Caw (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The ancient deep crow uses Shadow Caw.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The ancient deep crow beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the deep crow must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The ancient deep crow can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Regional Effects
legendary.text: The region containing an ancient deep crow's lair is transformed by the creature's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:
• Supernatural shadow turns all bright light to dim light in underground regions within 6 miles of the lair.
• Intermittent, echoing caws can be heard coming from all directions within 6 miles of the lair.

• Subterranean beasts within 1 mile of the ancient deep crow's lair serve as the creature's eyes and ears, alerting it to the presence of intruders and making it all but impossible to surprise the ancient deep crow. If the ancient deep crow dies, these effects fade immediately.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 210

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The deep crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the deep crow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the deep crow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The deep crow makes three attacks: one with its mandibles and two with its claws.

action.name: Mandibles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the deep crow can't use its mandibles on another target.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

monster.name: Donaar Blit'zen
monster.resist: acid

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 201

trait.name: Champion Challenge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: As a bonus action, Donaar causes each creature of his choice that he can see within 30 feet of him to make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature can't willingly move more than 30 feet away from Donaar. This effect ends on the creature if Donaar is incapacitated or dies, or if the creature is moved more than 30 feet away from him.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Donaar is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following paladin spells prepared:
• 1st level (4 slots): command, compelled duel, cure wounds, wrathful smite
• 2nd level (2 slots): aid, branding smite, lesser restoration, warding bond, zone of truth

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Donaar makes two attacks with his greatsword or his whip.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage. Whenever Donaar rolls a 1 or 2 on a damage die, he can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

action.name: Whip
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Vomit
action.text: Donaar regurgitates acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: command, compelled duel, cure wounds, wrathful smite, aid, branding smite, lesser restoration, warding bond, zone of truth

monster.name: Brahma Lutier

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 205

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Brahma has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Brahma is a 4th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following bard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, message, vicious mockery
• 1st level (4 slots): charm person, heroism, illusory script, sleep, unseen servant
• 2nd level (3 slots): cloud of daggers, invisibility

trait.name: Taunt (2/Day)
trait.text: Brahma can use a bonus action to target one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can hear Brahma, it must succeed on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the start of Brahma's next turn.

action.name: War Lute
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Song of Domination (3/day)
action.text: Brahma targets one creature that can see or hear her, which must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by her for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. It has disadvantage on these saves if being charmed by Brahma is something the target openly or secretly desires. For 1 hour after the charm effect ends, the target has disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma checks made as part of a contest with Brahma.

monster.spells: mage hand, message, vicious mockery, charm person, heroism, illusory script, sleep, unseen servant, cloud of daggers, invisibility

monster.name: K'thriss Drow'b
monster.save: Str +0, Dex +3, Con +2, Int +3, Wis +3, Cha +7
monster.languages: Celestial, Common, Elvish, Undercommon; can read all writing

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 202

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: K'thriss wears a robe of stars (accounted for in his statistics). The robe allows him to cast the following spells: 6/day: magic missile (7 missiles)

trait.name: Awakened Mind
trait.text: K'thriss can telepathically speak to any creature he can see within 30 feet of him, provided the creature can understand at least one language.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: K'thriss has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, K'thriss has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: K'thriss's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights, disguise self
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: K'thriss is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). He regains his expended spell slots when he finishes a short or long rest, and knows the following warlock spells:
Cantrips (at will): chill touch, eldritch blast, mending, prestidigitation, thorn whip, vicious mockery
• 3rd level (2 slots): dissonant whispers, fly, hex, misty step, sending, shatter

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: K'thriss makes two attacks with his sickle. Sickle. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

monster.spells: dancing lights, disguise self, darkness, faerie fire, chill touch, eldritch blast, mending, prestidigitation, thorn whip, vicious mockery, dissonant whispers, fly, hex, misty step, sending, shatter

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: Oak has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Hand Crossbow

reaction.name: Return the Favor (3/day)
reaction.text: When Oak takes damage from a melee weapon attack, he can make a hooked dagger attack.

monster.name: Walnut Dankgrass

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 204

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Walnut has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: Walnut can attempt to hide even when she is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Wild Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
trait.text: As a bonus action, Walnut can assume the shape of a dire wolf. She can stay in this form for 3 hours or until she reverts to her normal form as a bonus action. She automatically reverts if she falls unconscious, drops to 0 hit points, or dies.
While transformed, Walnut's game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the dire wolf, except she retains her alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.
Her attacks in beast form are magical. While in beast form, Walnut can use a bonus action to expend one spell slot and regain 1d8 hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Walnut is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following druid spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, thorn whip
• 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, entangle, thunderwave
• 2nd level (3 slots): flame blade, moonbeam, pass without trace
• 3rd level (3 slots): call lightning, dispel magic, plant growth
• 4th level (1 slots): blight, freedom of movement

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Walnut makes two attacks with Foremother or her longbow.

action.name: Foremother (+1 Scimitar)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.spells: druidcraft, produce flame, thorn whip, cure wounds, entangle, thunderwave, flame blade, moonbeam, pass without trace, call lightning, dispel magic, plant growth, blight, freedom of movement

At will: detect thoughts
1/day each: augury

action.name: Longsword

action.name: Light Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Omin Dran
monster.skill: Deception +4, Insight +7, Intimidation +4, Medicine +7, Perception +7, Persuasion +4

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 196

trait.name: Divine Strike
trait.text: Once on each of his turns when he hits a creature with a weapon attack, Omin can cause the attack to deal an extra 4 (1d8) damage of the same type dealt by the weapon.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Omin has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Omin is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): guidance, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): bless, command, divine favor, shield of faith
• 2nd level (3 slots): enhance ability, hold person, magic weapon, silence, spiritual weapon
• 3rd level (3 slots): beacon of hope, crusader's mantle, dispel magic, mass healing word, spirit guardians
• 4th level (3 slots): death ward, freedom of movement, locate creature, stoneskin
• 5th level (1 slots): dispel evil and good, flame strike, hold monster, greater restoration, legend lore

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Omin makes two attacks with his maul.

action.name: Maul
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: War God's Blessing (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
reaction.text: When a creature within 30 feet of Omin makes an attack roll, but before learning whether it hits or misses, Omin can grant the creature a +10 bonus to that roll.

monster.spells: guidance, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy, bless, command, divine favor, shield of faith, enhance ability, hold person, magic weapon, silence, spiritual weapon, beacon of hope, crusader's mantle, dispel magic, mass healing word, spirit guardians, death ward, freedom of movement, locate creature, stoneskin, dispel evil and good, flame strike, hold monster, greater restoration, legend lore

monster.name: Rosie Beestinger

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 203

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: Rosie has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Halfling Nimbleness
trait.text: Rosie can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than hers.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If Rosie is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails. She can't use this trait if she's incapacitated.

trait.name: Shadow Step
trait.text: When Rosie is in dim light or darkness, she can use a bonus action to teleport 60 feet to an unoccupied space she can see that is also in dim light or darkness. She then has advantage on the first melee attack she makes before the end of the turn.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Rosie's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: minor illusion, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
1/day each: command, darkness, darkvision, pass without trace, silence

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Rosie makes three attacks, then makes two unarmed strike attacks.

action.name: Staff of the Master (+1 Quarterstaff)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. Rosie's unarmed strikes are magical.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
reaction.text: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, Rosie deflects the missile. The damage she takes from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + 9. If the damage is reduced to 0, she catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and she has a hand free.

monster.spells: minor illusion, sacred flame, thaumaturgy, command, darkness, darkvision, pass without trace, silence

trait.name: Benign Transportation (Recharges after Jim Casts a Conjuration Spell of 1st Level or Higher)
trait.text: As a bonus action, Jim teleports up to 30 feet to a space he can see. The space must be unoccupied or occupied by a willing Small or Medium creature. If the latter, Jim and the willing creature both teleport, swapping places.

trait.text: Jim is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, friends, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation

• 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, Jim's glowing coin*

• 4th level (3 slots): conjure minor elementals, polymorph
• 5th level (1 slots): mislead

action.name: Minor Conjuration
action.text: Jim conjures an inanimate object, no larger than 3 feet on a side and no more than 10 pounds, in his hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space he can see within 10 feet of him. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5 feet. It disappears if it takes any damage, after 1 hour, or when Jim uses this feature again.

trait.name: Evasion

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: Viari halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. He must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 208

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: Portentia deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Portentia that isn't incapacitated and Portentia doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Portentia makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: Portentia magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than her own, or back into her true form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (her choice). In a new form, Portentia retains her game statistics and ability to speak, but her AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and she gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that she lacks.

monster.name: Prophetess Dran

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Acquisitions Incorporated p. 208

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Prophetess is a 5th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). Prophetess has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary
• 2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon
• 3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

trait.name: Divine Eminence
trait.text: As a bonus action, Prophetess can expend a spell slot to cause her melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If Prophetess expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Prophetess has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

action.name: Maul
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.spells: light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy, cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary, lesser restoration, spiritual weapon, dispel magic, spirit guardians

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 283

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The absorber has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the absorber moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits its claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the absorber can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The absorber makes three attacks: one with its bite or Mind Bolt and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) force damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

action.name: Mind Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 22 (4d10) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Tail Ray
reaction.text: When the absorber takes damage from a spell, the absorber takes only half the triggering damage. If the spellcaster is within 60 feet of the absorber, the absorber can force the caster to make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the caster takes the other half of the damage.

monster.name: Aeorian Nullifier

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 283

trait.name: Horrid Gnashing
trait.text: The nullifier's mouths gnash incoherently while it can see any enemies. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the nullifier and can hear it must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature rolls a d8 to determine what it does during the current turn:
1-4: The creature is stunned until the end of the turn.
5-6: The creature is frightened until the end of the turn and uses its movement to get as far as possible from the nullifier.
7-8: The creature doesn't move, and it uses its action to make one melee attack against a random creature (other than itself) if one is within reach. It otherwise does nothing.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The nullifier's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: counterspell (see "Reactions" below), detect magic, dispel magic, see invisibility
1/day: antimagic field

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The nullifier has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The nullifier makes three attacks: one with its bites and two with its claws.

action.name: Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it's a creature. The nullifier has two claws, each of which can grapple one creature.

reaction.name: Counterspell
reaction.text: The nullifier attempts to interrupt a creature that it can see within 60 feet in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, the nullifier makes a Charisma check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

monster.spells: counterspell, detect magic, dispel magic, see invisibility, antimagic field

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 284

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The reverser has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The reverser makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 6 (1d12) force damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

reaction.name: Reversal
reaction.text: When a creature the reverser can see within 30 feet of it regains hit points, the reverser reduces the number of hit points regained to 0, and the reverser deals 13 (3d8) force damage to the creature.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 126

trait.name: Fear of Fire
trait.text: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
trait.text: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

action.name: Chilling Gaze
action.text: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 21 (6d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to this yeti's gaze for 1 hour.

action.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 6)
action.text: The yeti exhales a 30-foot cone of frigid air. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 126

trait.name: Fear of Fire
trait.text: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
trait.text: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

action.name: Chilling Gaze
action.text: The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 (3d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

monster.name: Animated Knife
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 248

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
trait.text: The knife is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the knife must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the knife remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal knife.

action.name: Longknife
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

monster.name: Animated Tree
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, necrotic, radiant

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 130

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The tree deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tree makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
action.text: The tree magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a tree, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the tree. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the tree dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the tree takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

monster.name: Blood Hunter

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 284

trait.name: Blood Curse of Binding (1/Day)
trait.text: As a bonus action, the blood hunter targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 and be unable to take reactions. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The blood hunter has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
trait.text: The blood hunter can innately cast hex. Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence.
At will: hex

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The blood hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The blood hunter attacks twice with a weapon.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

monster.spells: hex

monster.name: Bol'bara

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 261

trait.name: Dark One's Blessing
trait.text: When Bol'bara reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points, she gains 6 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: Bol'bara can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Bol'bara's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: eldritch blast, false life, mage armor, mage hand
1/day each: charm person, hex, hold person, invisibility

trait.name: Possessed Alignment
trait.text: When Bol'bara is fully possessed, her alignment becomes Chaotic Evil.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Bol'bara makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) force damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (2/Turn)
legendary.text: Bol'bara can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Bol'bara regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Incorporeal Dash
legendary.text: Bol'bara moves up to her speed. She can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

legendary.name: Zone of Calamity (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: A 15-foot-radius sphere of magical confusion extends from a point Bol'bara can see within 60 feet of her and spreads around corners. Each creature that starts its turn in that area is treated as if targeted by the confusion spell (save DC 12). The sphere lasts as long as Bol'bara maintains concentration, up to 1 minute (as if concentrating on a spell).

monster.spells: eldritch blast, false life, mage armor, mage hand, charm person, hex, hold person, invisibility

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 295

trait.name: Bladed Hide
trait.text: At the start of each of its turns, the moorbounder deals 5 (2d4) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The moorbounder's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The moorbounder makes two attacks: one with its blades and one with its claws.

action.name: Blades
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) slashing damage.

monster.name: Core Spawn Crawler
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak
monster.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), tremorsense 60 ft.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 286

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The crawler has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the crawler's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The crawler makes four attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the start of the crawler's next turn.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Core Spawn Emissary
monster.languages: telepathy 120 ft., understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 286

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The emissary has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The emissary makes three talons attacks.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Alluring Thrum (Recharges 5-6)
action.text: The emissary emits a dreadful yet alluring hum. Each creature within 20 feet of the emissary that can hear it and that isn't an aberration must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be charmed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Crystal Spores (Recharge 6)
action.text: A 15-foot-radius cloud of toxic crystalline spores extends out from the emissary. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a creature takes 11 (2d10) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Core Spawn Seer
monster.languages: Common, Deep Speech, telepathy 120 ft., Undercommon

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 286

trait.name: Earth Glide
trait.text: The seer can traverse through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the seer doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The seer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The seer uses Fission Staff twice, Psychedelic Orb twice, or each one once.

action.name: Fission Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage, and the target is knocked prone.

action.name: Psychedelic Orb
action.text: The seer hurls a glimmering orb at one creature it can see within 120 of it. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage and suffer a random condition until the start of the seer's next turn. Roll a d6 for the condition: (1-2) blinded, (3-4) frightened, or (5-6) stunned.

reaction.name: Fuse Damage
reaction.text: When the seer is hit by an attack, it takes only half of the triggering damage. The first time the seer hits with a melee attack on its next turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage.

monster.name: Core Spawn Worm
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 287

trait.name: Illumination
trait.text: The worm sheds dim light in a 20-foot radius.

trait.name: Radiant Mirror
trait.text: If the worm takes radiant damage, each creature within 20 feet of it takes that damage as well.

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The worm makes two attacks: one with its barbed tentacles and one with its bite.

action.name: Barbed Tentacles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 25 (5d6 + 8) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The tentacles can grapple only one creature at a time.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (5d8 + 8) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and takes 21 (6d6) fire damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.

If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.name: Damaged Flesh Golem
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.immune: lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 248

trait.name: Berserk
trait.text: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

trait.name: Aversion of Fire
trait.text: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Ferol Sal
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 249

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, Ferol has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Ferol makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under Ferol's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. Ferol can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 288

trait.name: Numbing Aura
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature can't make more than one attack, or take a bonus action on that turn.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is fire, radiant, or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zombie makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Hurl Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Freezing Stare
action.text: The zombie targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 35 (10d6) cold damage and be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 289

trait.name: Freezing Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the worm or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) cold damage.

trait.name: Death Burst
trait.text: When the worm dies, it explodes in a burst of frigid energy. Each creature within 60 feet of it must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures inside the worm when it dies automatically fail this saving throw.

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The worm makes two bite attacks, or uses its Trill and makes a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and 10 (3d6) cold damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.

If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the worm.

action.name: Trill
action.text: The frost worm emits a haunting cry. Each creature within 60 feet of the worm that can hear it must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw each time it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once a creature successfully saves against this effect, or if this effect ends for it, that creature is immune to the Trill of all frost worms for the next 24 hours. Frost worms are immune to this effect.

monster.name: Gearkeeper Construct
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 290

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The gearkeeper is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Rapid Shifting
trait.text: Opportunity attacks made against the gearkeeper have disadvantage.

trait.name: Whirling Blades
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the gearkeeper takes 4 (1d8) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gearkeeper makes two Arm Blade attacks, or one Arm Blade attack and one Spear Launcher attack.

action.name: Arm Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear Launcher
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is knocked prone.

action.name: Shrapnel Blast (Recharge 6)
action.text: The gearkeeper jettisons a spray of jagged metal in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 291

trait.name: Shadowstep
trait.text: As a bonus action, the gloomstalker can teleport up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the gloomstalker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The gloomstalker makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Snatch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). While grappled in this way, the target is restrained.

action.name: Shriek (Recharge 6)
action.text: The gloomstalker emits a terrible shriek. Each enemy within 60 feet of the gloomstalker that can hear it must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of the enemy's next turn.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 272

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wolf makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 292

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The tortoise can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Massive Frame
trait.text: The tortoise can carry up to 20,000 pounds of weight atop its shell, but moves at half speed if the weight exceeds 10,000 pounds. Medium or smaller creatures can move underneath the tortoise while it's not prone.
Any creature under the tortoise when it falls prone is grappled (escape DC 18). Until the grapple ends, the creature is prone and restrained.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shell Defense (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: The tortoise withdraws into its shell, falls prone, and gains a +5 bonus to AC. While the tortoise is in its shell, its speed is 0 and can't increase. The tortoise can emerge from its shell as an action, whereupon it is no longer prone.

monster.name: Hulil Lutan
monster.resist: poison

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 240

trait.name: Dark Devotion
trait.text: Hulil has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
trait.text: Hulil has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: Hulil is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 11, +3 to hit with spell attacks). Hulil has the following cleric spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy
• 1st level (4 slots): command, inflict wounds, shield of faith
• 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, spiritual weapon

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Hulil makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.spells: light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy, command, inflict wounds, shield of faith, hold person, spiritual weapon

monster.name: Husk Zombie
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 293

trait.name: Curse of the Husk
trait.text: A humanoid slain by a melee attack from the zombie revives as a husk zombie on its next turn.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The zombie makes two claw attacks. For each of these attacks that reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the zombie can make an additional claw attack.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Variant: Husk Zombie Bursters
action.text: Some husk zombies become bloated with disease and bile, their frenzied state pushing them to rush other living creatures, explode, and spread their horrid infection. A husk zombie burster has the following additional action option:

action.name: Burst
action.text: The zombie explodes and is destroyed. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A humanoid creature killed by this damage rises as a husk zombie after 1 minute.

monster.name: Ishel

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 231

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Ishel has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put Ishel to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, Ishel has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Ishel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: dancing lights
1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

action.name: Variant: Drow Magic Armor and Weapons
action.text: Drow often wear magic armor and carry magic weapons that lose their enhancement bonuses permanently if they are exposed to sunlight for 1 hour or longer. A drow wearing a chain shirt +1 and carrying a shortsword +1 has AC 16 and a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with shortsword attacks.

monster.spells: dancing lights, darkness, faerie fire

monster.name: Karkethzerethzerus, the Sable Despoiler
monster.resist: necrotic

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Explorer's Guide to Wildemount p. 158

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
