trait.text: At the start of his turn, Antigonos can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Decrepit State
trait.text: Antigonos has disadvantage on his attack rolls.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Amphora
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If there is not already a creature inside the amphora, the target is restrained inside. As an action, the restrained creature can make a DC 14 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, escaping from the amphora on a success. The effect also ends if the amphora is destroyed. The amphora has AC 8, 20 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

monster.name: Bronze Sable
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 210

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the sable remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The sable has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sable's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If the sable surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sable makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Burnished Hart
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 211

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the hart moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an antlers attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the hart or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The hart has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hart makes two attacks: one with its antlers and one with its hooves.

action.name: Antlers
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

monster.name: Colossus of Akros
monster.languages: understands Common and Celestial but can't speak
monster.immune: fire, poison, psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, stunned, unconscious

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 218

trait.name: Crumbling Destruction
trait.text: When the colossus drops to 0 hit points, it crumbles and is destroyed. Any creature on the ground within 30 feet of the crumbling statue must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) bludgeoning damage and 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the colossus is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The colossus's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The colossus of Akros makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., or range 200/600 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) piercing damage, or 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the colossus makes a ranged attack with this spear, the spear magically returns to its hand after the attack.

action.name: Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (6d8 + 9) slashing damage.

action.name: Flames of Akros (Recharge 6)
action.text: Magical flames issue from the colossus toward up to three creatures the colossus can see within 90 feet of it. Each target must make a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a target also magically catches fire for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the burning target repeats the saving throw. It takes 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, and the effect ends on a successful one.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 224

trait.name: Aura of Erebos
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the giant must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, or it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the giant's Aura of Erebos for 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The giant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Noxious Gust (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The giant exhales a mighty gust that creates a blast of deadly mist in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

monster.name: Eater of Hope
monster.resist: cold, necrotic

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 220

trait.name: Insatiable Greed
trait.text: The eater of hope can sense the presence of gold within 1,000 feet of itself. It can determine which location has the greatest amount of gold and can sense the direction to that site. If the gold is being moved, it knows the direction of the movement. It can't locate gold if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between it and the gold.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The eater of hope has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eater of hope makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Breath of Hopelessness (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The eater of hope exhales a miasma of Underworld winds in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and is cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this way, the target takes an extra 6 (1d12) necrotic damage whenever the eater of hope hits it with an attack. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't cursed.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 223

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Running Leap
trait.text: With a 10-foot running start, the lion can long jump up to 25 feet.

trait.name: Spell Turning
trait.text: The lion has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the lion (not an area). If the lion's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the lion and instead targets the caster.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lion makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (2/Turn)
legendary.text: The lion can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The lion regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Claw
legendary.text: The lion makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The lion emits a magical roar. Each creature within 60 feet of the lion that can hear the roar must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the lion until the end of the lion's next turn.

monster.name: Flitterstep Eidolon
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 222

trait.name: Blurred Form
trait.text: Attack rolls against the eidolon are made with disadvantage unless the eidolon is incapacitated.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the eidolon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the eidolon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eidolon makes two melee attacks. Immediately before or after one of its attacks, it can use Flitterstep if it is available.

action.name: Flickering Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Flitterstep (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The eidolon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it. If it makes an attack immediately after teleporting, it has advantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Ghostblade Eidolon
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life
monster.resist: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 222

trait.name: Blurred Form
trait.text: Attack rolls against the eidolon are made with disadvantage unless the eidolon is incapacitated.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eidolon makes two ghostblade attacks.

action.name: Ghostblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage.

monster.name: Gold-Forged Sentinel
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 211

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the sentinel moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Spell Turning
trait.text: The sentinel has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the sentinel (not an area). If the sentinel's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the sentinel and instead targets the caster.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sentinel makes two ram attacks.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The sentinel exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Hippocamp
monster.resist: cold

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 227

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The hippocamp can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the hippocamp moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 225

trait.name: Reactive
trait.text: The giant can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Vigilant
trait.text: The giant can't be surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes four longsword attacks or two rock attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reaction.name: Deflect Attack
reaction.text: The giant adds 5 to its AC against one weapon attack that would hit it. To do so, the giant must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.name: Hythonia

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 252

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Hythonia's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18). She can innately cast animate objects once per day requiring no material components.
1/day: animate objects

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Hythonia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
trait.text: When a creature that can see Hythonia's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of her, Hythonia can force it to make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw if she isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, on a failed save the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Hythonia until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Hythonia in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If Hythonia sees herself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of her and in an area of bright light, she is affected by her own gaze.

trait.name: Shed Skin (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: If Hythonia is reduced to 0 hit points, she doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, she sheds her skin, regains 199 hit points, and moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Hythonia makes three attacks: one with her claws, one to constrict, and one with her snaky hair.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and Hythonia can't constrict another target.

action.name: Snaky Hair
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (4d12 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and Hythonia can pull the target up to 5 feet closer to her if it is a Large or smaller creature.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Hythonia can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Hythonia regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: Hythonia moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Snaky Hair
legendary.text: Hythonia makes one attack with her snaky hair.

legendary.name: Petrified Earth (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Hythonia causes stone spikes to erupt from the ground in a 30-foot radius centered on her. The area becomes difficult terrain until the start of her next turn. Any creature, other than Hythonia, takes 9 (2d8) piercing damage for every 5 feet it moves on those spikes.

legendary.name: Mythic Actions
legendary.text: If Hythonia's mythic trait is active, she can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Shed Skin.

legendary.name: Numbing Claws
legendary.text: Hythonia makes two attacks with her claws. If both attacks hit the same creature, it takes an extra 7 (2d6) poison damage and must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or become paralyzed until the start of her next turn.

legendary.name: Look at Me (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Hythonia can force a sighted creature she has grappled to see her eyes and be affected by her gaze.

monster.spells: animate objects

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 231

trait.name: Acidic Blood
trait.text: When the hydra takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of the hydra takes 9 (2d8) acid damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
trait.text: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Whenever the hydra takes 35 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
trait.text: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
trait.text: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage.

monster.name: Lampad
monster.resist: necrotic

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 235

trait.name: Corpse Stride
trait.text: Once on its turn, the lampad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one creature's corpse within its reach and emerge from a second creature's corpse within 60 feet of the first corpse, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second corpse. Both corpses must be Medium or bigger.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The lampad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (+6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: chill touch (see "Actions" below), gentle repose

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The lampad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lampad attacks twice with its necrotic touch or chill touch.

action.name: Necrotic Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) necrotic damage.

action.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the lampad's next turn. If the target is undead, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the lampad until the end of the lampad's next turn.

monster.spells: chill touch, gentle repose

monster.name: Leonin Iconoclast

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 232

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the leonin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The leonin's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: banishment, detect evil and good

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the leonin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The leonin makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

action.name: Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.spells: banishment, detect evil and good

monster.name: Meletian Hoplite

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 229

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The hoplite is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost (see "Actions" below)
• 1st level (4 slots): color spray, expeditious retreat, sleep
• 2nd level (2 slots): blur, cloud of daggers, invisibility

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hoplite makes three weapon attacks. It can replace one weapon attack with ray of frost.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Ray of Frost (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the hoplite's next turn.

monster.spells: mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost, color spray, expeditious retreat, sleep, blur, cloud of daggers, invisibility

monster.name: Naiad
monster.resist: psychic

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 236

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The naiad can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The naiad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: minor illusion
3/day: phantasmal force
1/day each: fly, hypnotic pattern

trait.name: Invisible in Water
trait.text: The naiad is invisible while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The naiad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The naiad makes two psychic touch attacks.

action.name: Psychic Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) psychic damage.

monster.spells: minor illusion, phantasmal force, fly, hypnotic pattern

monster.name: Nightmare Shepherd
monster.resist: cold, necrotic

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 221

trait.name: Aura of Nightmares
trait.text: Undead creatures within 30 feet of the shepherd gain a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When any other creature that isn't undead or a construct starts its turn within 30 feet of the shepherd, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The shepherd's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: confusion, dispel magic, hold person, suggestion

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The shepherd has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shepherd makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its staff.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 26 (4d12) psychic damage.

action.name: Herd the Underworld (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The shepherd pulls twisted souls from the Underworld; 1d6 shadows (without Sunlight Weakness; see the Monster Manual) arise in unoccupied spaces within 20 feet of the shepherd. The shadows act right after the shepherd on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear when the shepherd dies.

monster.spells: confusion, dispel magic, hold person, suggestion

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 233

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the ram moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The ram has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The ram has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

monster.name: Oracle

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 238

trait.name: Blessings of the Gods
trait.text: While the oracle is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier. In addition, a creature that hits the oracle with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) force damage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The oracle's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: guidance, light, thaumaturgy
3/day each: bless, guiding bolt, healing word, hold person
1/day each: augury, scrying

action.name: Eldritch Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) force damage.

reaction.name: Divine Insight (3/Day)
reaction.text: When the oracle or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the oracle can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.

monster.spells: guidance, light, thaumaturgy, bless, guiding bolt, healing word, hold person, augury, scrying

monster.name: Oread

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 237

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The oread's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: fire bolt (see "Actions" below)
3/day: burning hands
1/day each: hellish rebuke (see "Reactions" below), scorching ray

trait.name: Invisible in Fire
trait.text: The oread is invisible while fully immersed in fire.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The oread has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The oread attacks twice with its fiery touch or fire bolt.

action.name: Fiery Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke (2nd-Level Spell; 1/Day)
reaction.text: When the oread is damaged by a creature within 60 feet of the oread that it can see, the creature that damaged the oread must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: fire bolt, burning hands, hellish rebuke, scorching ray

monster.name: Phylaskia
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 239

trait.name: Gatekeeper's Aura
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the phylaskia must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws and its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the phylaskia to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the phylaskia drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Vigilant
trait.text: The phylaskia can't be surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The phylaskia makes two longsword attacks and uses its Strength Drain once.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

action.name: Strength Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage. Unless the target is immune to necrotic damage, its Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 231

trait.name: Acidic Blood
trait.text: When Polukranos takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of Polukranos takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: Polukranos can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Polukranos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
trait.text: Polukranos has five heads. While it has more than one head, Polukranos has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Whenever Polukranos takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, Polukranos dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken 40 or more fire damage since its last turn. Polukranos regains 20 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
trait.text: For each head Polukranos has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only to make opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: Polukranos deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Wakeful
trait.text: While Polukranos sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Polukranos makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 21 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away from Polukranos.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Polukranos can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Polukranos regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: Polukranos makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
legendary.text: Polukranos makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Trampling Charge (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Polukranos moves up to 50 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature Huge or smaller. The first time it enters each creature's space during this move, it can make a stomp attack against that creature.

trait.name: Turn Resistance

trait.name: Unreadable Face
trait.text: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Underworld Bolt

trait.name: Unreadable Face
trait.text: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Unreadable Face
trait.text: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 242

trait.name: Enthralling Performance
trait.text: If the satyr performs for at least 1 minute, it chooses up to four humanoids within 60 feet of it who watched or listened to the entire performance. Each target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed. While charmed in this way, the target idolizes the satyr and will take part in the satyr's revels. The charmed condition ends for the creature after 1 hour, if it takes any damage, if the satyr attacks the target, or if the target witnesses the satyr attacking or damaging any of the target's allies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sleepless Reveler
trait.text: Magic can't put the satyr to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The satyr makes two ram attacks or two shortbow attacks.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 243

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sleepless Reveler
trait.text: Magic can't put the satyr to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The satyr makes three ram attacks or three shortbow attacks.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Hail of Arrows (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The satyr fires an arrow that magically transforms into a flurry of missiles in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 229

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The hoplite has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hoplite's allies is within 5 feet of the hoplite and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hoplite makes two scimitar attacks or two longbow attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 216

trait.name: Spell Turning
trait.text: The chimera has advantage on a saving throw against any spell that targets only the chimera (not an area). If the chimera's saving throw is successful and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the chimera and instead targets the caster.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its claws, one with its head, and one with its tail. When its breath weapon is available, it can use the breath in place of its head or its claws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Head
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The chimera exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 32 (5d12) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Triton Master of Waves
monster.resist: cold, fire

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 245

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The triton can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The triton's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: ray of frost (see "Actions" below)
2/day: cone of cold
1/day each: fog cloud, gust of wind, wind wall

trait.name: Summon Water Weird (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: As a bonus action, the triton magically summons 1d4} {@creature water weird. The summoned weirds appear in unoccupied spaces in water within 60 feet of the triton. The water weirds act immediately after the triton on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear if the triton dies.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The triton makes two attacks using Wave Touch and casts ray of frost.

action.name: Wave Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d10) cold damage.

action.name: Ray of Frost (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the triton's next turn.

reaction.name: Frigid Shield
reaction.text: When a creature the triton can see targets the triton with an attack, the triton gains 10 temporary hit points. If the attack hits and reduces the temporary hit points to 0, each creature within 5 feet of the triton takes 9 (2d8) cold damage.

monster.spells: ray of frost, cone of cold, fog cloud, gust of wind, wind wall

monster.name: Triton Shorestalker
monster.resist: cold

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 244

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The triton can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The triton's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/day each: fog cloud, gust of wind

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: The triton can take the Disengage or Hide actions as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The triton makes two urchin-spine shortsword attacks.

action.name: Urchin-Spine Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage. If the damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Poisoned Spine
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

monster.spells: fog cloud, gust of wind

monster.name: Tromokratis
monster.resist: cold, lightning, thunder
monster.immune: fire; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 254

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Tromokratis can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Hearts of the Kraken (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: When Tromokratis is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, the damage creates cracks in its carapace, revealing its hearts. Tromokratis has four hearts: two on its chest, one on its back, and one at the base of its tail. A heart has an AC of 22 and 100 hit points. It is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, and it is immune to all conditions. If it is forced to make a saving throw, treat its ability scores as 10 (+0). If it finishes a short or long rest, the carapace heals, any destroyed hearts regenerate, and the hearts are covered again. Tromokratis dies when all the hearts are destroyed.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Tromokratis fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Tromokratis's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: Tromokratis deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Spell-Resistant Carapace
trait.text: Tromokratis has advantage on saving throws against spells, and any creature that makes a spell attack against Tromokratis has disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Tromokratis makes three attacks: one with its pincer, one with its tail, and one with its tentacle grasp.

action.name: Pincer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 26). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Tromokratis can't use this attack on anyone else.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it is knocked prone.

action.name: Tentacle Grasp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. Hit: 20 (3d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 26). If the target doesn't escape by the end of its next turn, Tromokratis throws the target up to 60 feet in a straight line. The target lands prone and takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature grappled by Tromokratis, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Tromokratis, and it takes 42 (12d6) acid damage at the start of each of Tromokratis's turns. If Tromokratis takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, Tromokratis must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of Tromokratis. If Tromokratis dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Tromokratis can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Tromokratis regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: Tromokratis moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Tail
legendary.text: Tromokratis makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Tromokratis makes one bite attack.

legendary.name: Mythic Actions
legendary.text: If Tromokratis's mythic trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Hearts of the Kraken.

legendary.name: Rampage
legendary.text: Tromokratis makes two attacks: one with its tail and one with its tentacle grasp.

legendary.name: Coral Growth (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Each creature within 10 feet of Tromokratis must make a DC 25 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 (3d8) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Until the start of its next turn, Tromokratis and its hearts gain a +2 bonus to AC.

monster.name: Two-Headed Cerberus
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, stunned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 215

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the cerberus can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Multiheaded
trait.text: The cerberus can't be surprised, and it has advantage on saving throws against being knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The cerberus has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the cerberus's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cerberus makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The cerberus exhales a 15-foot cone of molten rock. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a creature is also restrained by the hardening rock. A creature can make a DC 12 Strength (Athletics) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and 10 hit points, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 246

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The typhon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The typhon regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The typhon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The typhon makes three attacks: one with its Flurry of Bites, one to constrict, and one with its maw.

action.name: Flurry of Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (8d6 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The typhon can have up to two creatures constricted.

action.name: Maw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage plus 19 (3d12) acid damage.

monster.name: Underworld Cerberus
monster.languages: understands all languages but can't speak
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, stunned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 215

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the cerberus can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Multiheaded
trait.text: The cerberus can't be surprised, and it has advantage on saving throws against being knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The cerberus has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the cerberus's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cerberus makes three bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The cerberus exhales a 30-foot cone of molten rock. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a creature is also restrained by the hardening rock. A creature can make a DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and 20 hit points, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 214

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the bull moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 19 (3d12) piercing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 214

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Mythic Odysseys of Theros p. 247

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
trait.text: The woe strider's open mouth creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 60-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the woe strider decides which way the cone faces and whether its mouth is open or closed.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The woe strider makes two claw attacks and one bite attack. If both claws hit the same creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 14).

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is grappled, incapacitated, or restrained. 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage. In addition, each magic item the creature is carrying that isn't an artifact has its magical properties suppressed for 1 minute.

monster.name: Apprentice

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 201

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: You cast one of the following wizard spells (spell save DC 11), using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:
At will: minor illusion
2/day: grease

action.name: Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 − 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 − 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Burning Hands (1st-Level Spell; 2/Day)
action.text: You shoot forth a 15-foot cone of fire. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

monster.spells: minor illusion, fire bolt, burning hands, grease

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 201

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Disengage (Bonus Action)
action.text: You take the Disengage action.

monster.name: Disciple

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 201

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: You cast one the following cleric spells (spell save DC 11), using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:
At will: guidance
2/day: cure wounds

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sacred Flame (Cantrip)
action.text: You target one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or take 4 (1d8) radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

monster.spells: guidance, sacred flame, cure wounds

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 201

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shove (Bonus Action)
action.text: While wielding a shield, you try to shove one creature within 5 feet of you.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 226

trait.name: Podling Link
trait.text: The plant can see through and communicate telepathically with any of its podlings within 10 miles of it. Rejuvenation. When the plant dies, it returns to life in the place where it died 1d12 months later, unless the ground where it took root is sown with salt or soaked with poison. Unusual Nature. The plant doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The plant makes three Vine Lash attacks.

action.name: Vine Lash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained. The plant has four vines, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Entrapping Pod
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature grappled by the plant. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage, and the target is pulled into the plant's space and enveloped by the pod, and the grapple ends. While enveloped, the target is restrained, and it has total cover against attacks and effects originating outside the pod. The enveloped target must also immediately succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be stunned by the plant's sapping enzymes until it is removed from the pod or the plant dies. The enveloped target doesn't require air and gains 1 level of exhaustion for each hour it spends in the pod. If the target dies while enveloped, it immediately emerges from the pod as a living podling, wearing or carrying all of the original creature's equipment. As an action, a creature within 5 feet of the bodytaker plant that is outside the pod can open the pod and pull the target free with a successful DC 15 Strength check. If the plant dies, the target is no longer restrained and can escape from the pod by spending 10 feet of movement, exiting prone. The plant has one pod, which can envelop one creature at a time.

monster.name: Podling
monster.languages: Deep Speech, the languages the creature knew in life

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 227

trait.name: Semblance of Life
trait.text: The podling is a physical copy of a creature digested by a bodytaker plant. The podling has the digested creature's memories and behaves like that creature, but with occasional lapses. An observer familiar with the digested creature can recognize the discrepancies with a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Insight) check, or automatically if the podling does something in direct contradiction to the digested creature's established beliefs or behavior. The podling melts into a slurry when it dies, when the bodytaker plant that created it dies, or when the bodytaker plant dismisses it (no action required).

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The podling doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Boneless
monster.resist: bludgeoning, poison
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 228

trait.name: Compression
trait.text: The boneless can move through any opening at least 1 inch wide without squeezing. It can also squeeze to fit into a space that a Tiny creature could fit in.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The boneless doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The boneless makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Large or smaller creature, the creature is grappled(escape DC 13), and the boneless can use Crushing Embrace.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Crushing Embrace
action.text: The boneless wraps its body around a Large or smaller creature grappled by it. While the boneless is attached, the target is blinded and is unable to breathe. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw at the start of each of the boneless' turns or take 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If something moves the target, the boneless moves with it. The boneless can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can use its action to try to detach the boneless and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful DC 13 Strength check. When the boneless dies, it detaches from any creature it is attached to.

monster.name: Brain In A Jar
monster.senses: blindsight 120 ft. (blind beyond this radius); see also "Detect Sentience" below
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden p. 279, Lost Laboratory of Kwalish p. 38, Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 278

trait.name: Detect Sentience
trait.text: The brain can sense the presence and location of any creature within 300 feet of it that has an Intelligence of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a mind blank spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The brain doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
trait.text: The brain casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
At will: detect thoughts, mage hand, zone of truth
3/day each: charm person, hold person
1/day each: compulsion, hold monster, sleep (3rd-level version), Tasha's hideous laughter

action.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the brain's next turn. If the target is Undead, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against the brain until the end of the brain's next turn.

action.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
action.text: The brain magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw or take 17 (3d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A stunnedcreature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: detect thoughts, mage hand, zone of truth, charm person, hold person, compulsion, hold monster, sleep (3rd-level version), Tasha's hideous laughter

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 230

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The carrion stalker makes three Tentacle attacks. If it is attached to a creature, it can replace one Tentacle attack with Larval Burst, if available.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the carrion stalker attaches to the target and pulls itself into the target's space. While attached, the carrion stalker moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it. A creature can use its action to try to detach the carrion stalker and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful DC 11 Strength check. On its turn, the carrion stalker can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement. When it dies, the carrion stalker detaches from any creature it is attached to.

action.name: Larval Burst (1/Day)
action.text: The carrion stalker releases a burst of larvae in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. A creature poisoned in this way takes 7 (2d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns as larvae infest its body. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any effect that cures disease or removes the poisonedcondition instantly kills the larvae in the creature, ending the effect on it. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by the infestation, it dies. The larvae remain in the corpse, and one survives to become a fully grown carrion stalker in 1d4 weeks. Any effect that cures diseases or removes the poisoned condition that targets the corpse instantly kills the larvae.

monster.name: Carrionette
monster.languages: understands the languages of its creator

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 231

trait.name: False Object
trait.text: If the carrionette is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the carrionette move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to discern that the carrionette is animate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The carrionette doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Silver Needle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or become cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this way, the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from each ability check or attack roll it makes.

action.name: Soul Swap
action.text: The carrionette targets a creature it can see within 15 feet of it that is cursed by its Silver Needle. Unless the target is protected by a protection from evil and good spell, it must succeed on a DC 12 Charisma saving throw or have its consciousness swapped with the carrionette. The carrionette gains control of the target's body, and the target is unconsciousfor 1 hour, after which it gains control of the carrionette's body. While controlling the target's body, the carrionette retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It otherwise uses the controlled body's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

If the carrionette's body is destroyed, both the carrionette and the target die. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the controlled body drives the carrionette out and returns the consciousness of both creatures to their original bodies. The swap is also undone if the controlled body takes damage from the carrionette's Silver Needle.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 232

trait.name: Beheaded Form
trait.text: When created, a death's head takes one of three forms: Aberrant Head, Gnashing Head, or Petrifying Head. This form determines the creature's attack.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The death's head doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Gnashing Bite (Gnashing Head Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Mind-Bending Bite (Aberrant Head Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack:+3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Intelligence saving throw or it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, the target must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three.

action.name: Petrifying Bite (Petrifying Head Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the target is petrified for 10 minutes.

monster.name: Dullahan
monster.skill: Perception +6 Damage Resistance cold, lightning, poison
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 233

trait.name: Headless Summoning (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: If the dullahan is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, it regains 97 hit points. In addition, it summons three death's heads, one of each type, in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of it. The death's heads are under the dullahan's control and act immediately after the dullahan in the initiative order. Additionally, the dullahan can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section. Award a party an additional 5,900 XP (11,800 XP total) for defeating the dullahan after it uses Headless Summoning

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If the dullahan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The dullahan doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dullahan makes two attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If the dullahan scores a critical hit against a creature, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or the dullahan cuts off the target's head. The target dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature that doesn't have or need a head, or has legendary actions, instead takes an extra 27 (6d8) slashing damage.

action.name: Fiery Skull
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) fire damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The dullahan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dullahan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The dullahan makes one attack.

legendary.name: Frightful Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Each creature of the dullahan's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the dullahan until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Head Hunt (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The dullahan moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes one Battleaxe attack with advantage. If the attack hits, but is not a critical hit, the attack deals an extra 27 (6d8) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Mythic Actions
legendary.text: If the dullahan's Headless Summoning trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions.

legendary.name: Coordinated Assault
legendary.text: The dullahan makes a Battleaxe attack, and then one death's head the dullahan can see within 30 feet of it can use its reaction to make a melee attack.

legendary.name: Headless Wail (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: An echoing shriek issues from the dullahan's headless stump. Each creature of the dullahan's choice within 10 feet of it must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. Each creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If one or more creatures fail the saving throw, the dullahan gains 10 temporary hit points.

monster.name: Gallows Speaker
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monster.languages: any languages its component spirits knew in life

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 234

trait.name: Divination Senses
trait.text: The gallows speaker can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The gallows speaker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends it turn inside an object.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The gallows speaker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Foretelling Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the next attack roll or saving throw it makes before the start of the gallows speaker's next turn.

action.name: Suffering Echoes
action.text: The gallows speaker targets a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage, and waves of painful memories leap from the target to up to three other creatures of the gallows speaker's choice that are within 30 feet of the target, each of which takes 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 235

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:3 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

reaction.name: Magic Allergy (1/Day)
reaction.text: Immediately after a creature within 30 feet of the gremishka casts a spell, the gremishka can spontaneously react to the magic. Roll a d6 to determine the effect:
1–2. The gremishka emanates magical energy. Each creature within 30 feet of the gremishka must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) force damage.
3–4. The gremishka surges with magical energy and regains 3 (1d6) hit points.
5–6. The gremishka explodes and dies, and one swarm of gremishkas instantly appears in the space where this gremishka died. The swarm uses the gremishka's initiative.

monster.name: Swarm Of Gremishkas
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 235

trait.name: Limited Spell Immunity
trait.text: The swarm automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of 3rd level or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells always miss it.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny gremishka. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

reaction.name: Spell Redirection
reaction.text: In response to a spell attack roll missing the swarm, the swarm causes that spell to hit another creature of its choice within 30 feet of it that it can see.

monster.name: Jiangshi
monster.languages: any languages it knew in life

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 236

trait.name: Jiangshi Weaknesses
trait.text: The jiangshi has the following flaws: Fear of Its Own Reflection. If the jiangshi sees its own reflection, it immediately uses its reaction, if available, to move as far away from the reflection as possible. Susceptible to Holy Symbols. While the jiangshi is wearing or touching a holy symbol, it automatically fails saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The jiangshi doesn't require air.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The jiangshi makes three Slam attacks and uses Consume Energy.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Consume Energy
action.text: The jiangshi draws energy from a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target makes a DC 16 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The jiangshi regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. After regaining hit points from this action, the jiangshi gains the following benefits for 7 days: its walking speed increases to 40 feet, and it gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed and can hover.

A Humanoid slain by this necrotic damage rises as a wight (see its entry in the Monster Manual) at the end of the jiangshi's turn. The wight acts immediately after the jiangshi in the initiative order. If this wight slays a Humanoid with its Life Drain, the wight transforms into a jiangshi 5 days later.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The jiangshi polymorphs into a Beast, a Humanoid, or an Undead that is Medium or Small or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the jiangshi's choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster.name: Loup Garou
monster.speed: 30 ft., 40 ft. in hybrid form, 50 ft. in dire wolf form

trait.name: Source
trait.text: Van Richten's Guide to Ravenloft p. 237

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The loup garou has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: When the loup garou fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The loup garou regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the loup garou takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the loup garou's next turn. The loup garou dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The loup garou makes two attacks: two with its Longsword (humanoid form) or one with its Bite and one with its Claws (dire wolf or hybrid form).

action.name: Bite (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with loup garou lycanthropy.

action.name: Claws (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack:+9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Longsword (Humanoid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Change Shape (Bonus Action)
